data.text: @zhfgjcftihfdyh1 @porterguy1 @TakeWeightOffMD Effective treatments that are drastically limited in supply? Treat a virus that causes brain, immune system, and organ damage? I would rather keep the virus out of my body completely. See my pinned post for my mask.

@ParentMishmash @porterguy1 @TakeWeightOffMD Nonsense. You have a gap anywhere, there goes your "protection".

So silly to still mask so much of the time in 2022 when there are already effective treatments for covid.

@zhfgjcftihfdyh1 @porterguy1 @TakeWeightOffMD They don’t have to be worn perfectly to help as source control or wearer protection. That just means less than 95% protection. Still more than the 0% of not wearing any mask.

@zhfgjcftihfdyh1 @porterguy1 @TakeWeightOffMD Dimmer switch. 
Fit testing not necessary. 
Some protection is better than no protection. 
Source control and wearer protection are additive.

https://t.co/RSb6KjTAU7
@ParentMishmash @porterguy1 @TakeWeightOffMD I'm telling you. In real life, no one does that.

@zhfgjcftihfdyh1 @porterguy1 @TakeWeightOffMD No again. Fit testing validates 95% effectiveness (more than “somewhat effective”). But again think of a dimmer switch or a sliding scale. Masks are not binary effective/not effective. The better the mask, and the more people wearing them, the better they work.

@ParentMishmash @porterguy1 @TakeWeightOffMD Only if it's fit tested and worn correctly. Then it MIGHT be a little somewhat effective. 

Which 99% of mask wearers in real life (as opposed to an artificial lab setting) don't do.
